moves.1. e4: This is a blitz game I played that ended quickly. My opponent starts off with the king pawn.
moves.2... Nf6: Threatening the queen while developing my pieces.
moves.3... Be7: I develop further and protect my king.
moves.4. d3 O-O: I castle for protection and to prepare my rook. I feel like I have more developed pieces than white because he was busy moving his queen.
moves.5. Qc3: This is the mistake. If I can safely get my bishop to b4, his queen is gone!
moves.6... Re8: Taking the e file and directing my rook at his king.
moves.8. Nc3: Didn't take it and protected his queen.
moves.8... Nd4: Getting my knight in a good position
moves.10... Bb4+: My opponent resigned. I concluded that developing your pieces and protecting your king are the most important things. And moving your queen around at the beginning of the game only causes problems
